Fasta extracta

Mar 11, 2014
1 minute read

You need bioruby for this one. Bioruby is quite easy to install on unix systems. I use Ubuntu… The script pulls the fasta entries from a multi-fasta file based on a provided list of sequence ids.

#!/usr/bin/env ruby
require 'bio'
include Bio
id_file = ARGV[0]
seq_file = ARGV[1]
ids = Array.new
File.new(id_file, 'r').each { |line| ids << line.chop }
File.open(id_file+'_fasta_extracted', 'w') do |file|
  Bio::FlatFile.auto(seq_file).each do |item|
    ids.each do |id|
      if item.definition =~ /#{id}/
        seq = Bio::FastaFormat.new('> '+item.definition+"\n"+item.data)
        file.puts seq
      end
    end
  end
end
